definition: to act against one's will/to have no alternative but to/to have to/to have no choice/must
(negative prefix)/not/no
structural particle: used after a verb (or adjective as main verb), linking it to following phrase indicating effect, degree, possibility etc
to have to/must/ought to/to need to
to obtain/to get/to gain/to catch (a disease)/proper/suitable/proud/contented/to allow/to permit/ready/finished
already/to stop/then/afterwards
to have no alternative (idiom); compelled by circumstances/forced into sth
to have no other choice/to be the last resort
pinyin: bu4 de2 yi3 er2 wei2 zhi1

definition: only when absolutely essential (idiom); as a last resort

sentences.english: Keeping our military and using them when we have to, but not as our first instrument.
sentences.chinese: 保存軍事力量，不到非不得已絕不輕易動武。

sentences.english: In an emergency, buyers under duress have no freedom.
sentences.chinese: 在緊急關頭，買家迫不得已別無選擇。

sentences.english: As a result, compaction is generally only done when it appears to be necessary.
sentences.chinese: 因此，通常只在萬不得已時才進行壓縮。

sentences.english: She had to sign an indenture to sell herself, because she owed money to the landlord .
sentences.chinese: 由於欠地主家的錢，她不得已簽了賣身契。

sentences.english: Surgical removal of a breast cyst is necessary only in a few unusual circumstances.
sentences.chinese: 只有在不得已的情況下才有必要做手術移除乳腺囊腫。

sentences.english: Work longer during the week if you have to.
sentences.chinese: 如果不得已，在周內多花些時間工作。

sentences.english: He could not but cough up his political scandal.
sentences.chinese: 他迫不得已只好吐露出他的政治醜聞。

sentences.english: Yeah, you've got to do what you've got to do. Pretty much.
sentences.chinese: 對，差不多吧，不得已而爲之。

sentences.english: The use of antibiotics is permitted only in extremis.
sentences.chinese: 只有在萬不得已的情況下才允許使用抗生素。

sentences.english: You don't want to give away any more of your future 4） profits than you have to.
sentences.chinese: 除非萬不得已，你不會想把更多未來的利潤拱手讓人。

sentences.english: They were asked to rededicate themselves to their country.
sentences.chinese: 他們不得已爲了國家再次獻身。

sentences.english: In order to survive, he had to be scrappier and more resourceful than his peers.
sentences.chinese: 迫不得已，蘭波變得比同輩更加好鬥和機警。

sentences.english: Such as we have to face computers everyday, is there any tip to protect eyes?
sentences.chinese: 不得已天天面對電腦，有簡便易行的“護眼大法”嗎？

sentences.english: Eddie noticed the 18)resigned look on the Blue Man's face.
sentences.chinese: 愛迪留意到藍皮人臉下迫不得已的表情。

sentences.english: That you've got to do what you've got to do in a case like that.
sentences.chinese: 在那種情況下，你只能不得已而爲之。

sentences.english: When you felt like it, or had to.
sentences.chinese: 在你有某種感覺或者迫不得已的時候。

definition: to have no alternative (idiom); compelled by circumstances/forced into sth
to be compelled/to be forced
to suffer/fig. reluctantly
to have no other choice/to be the last resort
pinyin: bu4 de2 yi3 er2 wei2 zhi1

definition: have no choice or option but to/cannot but/have to/can't help it/can't avoid
without any better option/to have to/to be forced to
to have no way out/to have no alternative
to have no alternative but to/to be obliged to
to force/to compel/to coerce
to be at an impasse (idiom)/in a tight spot/at the end of one's rope/desperate
constrained/restricted/forced to/under pressure to do sth
to settle for second best/the next best thing
to brace oneself to do sth/to put a bold face on it/to summon up courage/to force oneself to
there is nothing to be done/one can't do anything about it
to have no other choice
have no way out/have no alternative/abbr. to 無奈|无奈[wu2 nai4]
